statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Denzel Ingram made 8 of his 17 points in overtime as North Carolina-Wilmington slipped by College of Charleston 59-55 on Saturday night.
article.headline: NC-Wilmington slips past College of Charleston 59-55 in OT
article.linkText: NC-Wilmington slips past College of Charleston 59-55 in OT
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Denzel Ingram made 8 of his 17 points in overtime as North Carolina-Wilmington slipped by College of Charleston 59-55 on Saturday night. North Carolina-Wilmington (21-6, 13-3 Colonial Athletic Association) outscored the Cougars 10-6 in the extra period. Trailing 29-21 at the break, Charleston rallied to take a 47-42 lead with 5:29 left. Jordon Talley drilled a 3-pointer and C.J. Bryce had a layup to tie at 47. Charleston's James Bourne made a layup for a 49-47 lead with 2:49 remaining. Chris Flemmings made two free throws to tie with 40 seconds left. The Cougars (16-11, 8-8) had a chance for the win in regulation but Payton Hulsey missed two free throws with 13.8 seconds remaining. The Seahawks, who had won 11 consecutive before losing to William & Mary 87-69 on Thursday, remains 1.5 games in front of Hofstra (19-8, 11-4) in the conference standings. Hofstra and UNCW will face off on Thursday.
